verse: John 3:16 - For God so loved the world that He gave His one and only Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish but have eternal life.
excerpt: This verse illustrates the magnitude of God's love for humanity, giving His only Son so that we may have eternal life through belief in Him.

verse: Psalm 23:1-4 - The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for His name's sake. Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me.
excerpt: God, as our shepherd, provides for, guides, and protects us, even in the darkest times, ensuring that we lack nothing and experience His comfort.

verse: Philippians 4:13 - I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
excerpt: This verse reminds us that through the strength Christ provides, we are capable of overcoming any obstacle or challenge that we face in life.

verse: Jeremiah 29:11 - 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
excerpt: God reassures us that His plans for our lives are filled with hope and a bright future, designed to prosper us rather than harm us.

verse: Romans 8:28 - And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love Him, who have been called according to His purpose.
excerpt: Even in difficult circumstances, God orchestrates everything for the ultimate good of those who love Him and are aligned with His purpose.

verse: Proverbs 3:5-6 - Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make straight your paths.
excerpt: This passage encourages us to place our full trust in God, rather than relying on our limited understanding, and to acknowledge Him in all we do.

verse: Isaiah 41:10 - Fear not, for I am with you; be not dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with My righteous right hand.
excerpt: God promises His constant presence and strength in times of fear and trouble, offering His divine support to uphold us.

verse: Matthew 11:28-30 - Come to Me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. Take My yoke upon you, and learn from Me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls. For My yoke is easy, and My burden is light.
excerpt: Jesus offers rest to all who are burdened, promising that by following Him, we will experience peace and relief from life's pressures.

verse: Ephesians 2:8-9 - For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith—and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God—not by works, so that no one can boast.
excerpt: Salvation is a gift of grace from God, freely given and received through faith, without reliance on our works or personal achievements.

verse: Psalm 46:1-3 - God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear, though the earth gives way, though the mountains be moved into the heart of the sea, though its waters roar and foam, though the mountains tremble at its swelling.
excerpt: Even in the midst of chaos and natural disasters, we find safety and strength in God, who is always present and ready to help.

verse: Isaiah 40:31 - But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
excerpt: When we place our hope in God, He renews our strength, enabling us to persevere and rise above the challenges that life presents.

verse: Joshua 1:9 - Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.
excerpt: God commands us to be strong and courageous, assuring us that He is always with us, no matter where life takes us.

verse: 1 Peter 5:7 - Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you.
excerpt: God invites us to give Him all of our worries and anxieties, knowing that He cares deeply for each of us.

verse: Psalm 119:105 - Your word is a lamp for my feet, a light on my path.
excerpt: God’s word serves as a guiding light, illuminating our path and helping us navigate life with clarity and wisdom.

verse: Matthew 6:33 - But seek first His kingdom and His righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
excerpt: When we prioritize seeking God's kingdom and righteousness, He ensures that all of our needs are met.

verse: Romans 12:2 - Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—His good, pleasing, and perfect will.
excerpt: We are called to be transformed by renewing our minds, aligning with God's will rather than conforming to worldly values.

verse: Hebrews 11:1 - Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.
excerpt: Faith gives us the assurance and confidence in the promises of God, even when we cannot yet see them fulfilled.

verse: James 1:2-3 - Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.
excerpt: Trials and difficulties are opportunities for growth, building perseverance and strengthening our faith.

verse: Galatians 6:9 - Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
excerpt: Persevering in doing good will eventually bear fruit, as long as we don’t grow tired or give up.

verse: 1 Corinthians 10:13 - No temptation has overtaken you except what is common to mankind. And God is faithful; He will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, He will also provide a way out so that you can endure it.
excerpt: God promises that no temptation is too great, providing us with strength and a way out when faced with challenges.

verse: Psalm 34:17-18 - The righteous cry out, and the Lord hears them; He delivers them from all their troubles. The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.
excerpt: God is attentive to the cries of the righteous, especially those who are brokenhearted or crushed in spirit.

verse: Philippians 4:6-7 - Do not be anxious about anything, but in every situation, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God. And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
excerpt: Through prayer and thanksgiving, we find peace in God, surpassing all understanding and protecting our hearts and minds.

verse: Proverbs 18:10 - The name of the Lord is a fortified tower; the righteous run to it and are safe.
excerpt: God’s name is a strong tower, a place of safety and refuge for the righteous.

verse: Matthew 5:16 - In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
excerpt: We are called to be a light in the world, so that through our actions, others may glorify God.

verse: 1 John 1:9 - If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.
excerpt: God is faithful to forgive us and cleanse us from all sin if we confess to Him.

verse: Romans 8:31 - What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?
excerpt: With God on our side, no opposition or enemy can stand against us.

verse: Colossians 3:23 - Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters.
excerpt: Our work should be done wholeheartedly, as though we are working for God rather than for people.

verse: Isaiah 54:17 - No weapon forged against you will prevail, and you will refute every tongue that accuses you. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and this is their vindication from Me, declares the Lord.
excerpt: God promises protection and victory over any attacks or accusations against His people.

verse: Psalm 37:4 - Take delight in the Lord, and He will give you the desires of your heart.
excerpt: When we find our delight in God, He aligns our desires with His will and fulfills them.

verse: 2 Corinthians 5:7 - For we live by faith, not by sight.
excerpt: Our lives as believers are guided by faith, trusting in God's promises even when we cannot see the full picture.

verse: Matthew 7:7 - Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened to you.
excerpt: God encourages us to persist in seeking Him, promising that He will answer and open doors for us.

verse: Hebrews 13:5 - Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, 'Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.'
excerpt: God's constant presence and faithfulness is our source of contentment and security.

verse: Psalm 121:1-2 - I lift up my eyes to the mountains—where does my help come from? My help comes from the Lord, the Maker of heaven and earth.
excerpt: Our help comes from God, the Creator of everything, who is always ready to aid us.

verse: 1 Corinthians 13:4-7 - Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres.
excerpt: The qualities of love reflect God's character: patient, kind, and forgiving, enduring all things in hope and truth.

verse: Psalm 55:22 - Cast your burden on the Lord, and He will sustain you; He will never permit the righteous to be moved.
excerpt: God sustains and upholds those who place their burdens on Him, ensuring they are not shaken.

verse: Ephesians 6:10-11 - Finally, be strong in the Lord and in His mighty power. Put on the full armor of God, so that you can take your stand against the devil's schemes.
excerpt: God equips us with spiritual armor to stand firm against evil forces.

verse: Isaiah 26:3 - You will keep in perfect peace those whose minds are steadfast, because they trust in You.
excerpt: Perfect peace is found when we steadfastly trust in God.

verse: 2 Timothy 1:7 - For God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
excerpt: The Holy Spirit empowers us with strength, love, and self-discipline, rather than fear.

verse: Psalm 91:1-2 - Whoever dwells in the shelter of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty. I will say of the Lord, 'He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.'
excerpt: Dwelling in God's presence offers us rest, security, and protection.

verse: John 14:27 - Peace I leave with you; My peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
excerpt: Jesus grants us a divine peace that surpasses worldly understanding, bringing comfort in the midst of fear.

verse: Psalm 103:12 - As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.
excerpt: God's forgiveness is complete and removes our sins far from us, restoring us fully.

verse: James 1:12 - Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial because, having stood the test, that person will receive the crown of life that the Lord has promised to those who love Him.
excerpt: Endurance through trials leads to a reward from God—eternal life.

verse: Psalm 91:11-12 - For He will command His angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways; they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
excerpt: God sends His angels to protect and guide His people in every step.

verse: John 16:33 - I have told you these things, so that in Me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world.
excerpt: Though we face difficulties in life, we find peace in Christ, who has already overcome the world.

verse: Psalm 27:1 - The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid?
excerpt: God is our source of light and salvation, providing strength in times of fear.

verse: Isaiah 40:29 - He gives strength to the weary and increases the power of the weak.
excerpt: God empowers the weak and weary, renewing their strength.

verse: 2 Corinthians 12:9 - But He said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for My power is made perfect in weakness.' Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may rest on me.
excerpt: God's grace is enough for us, and His strength shines through our weaknesses.

verse: Lamentations 3:22-23 - Because of the Lord’s great love we are not consumed, for His compassions never fail. They are new every morning; great is Your faithfulness.
excerpt: God’s mercy and compassion are renewed every day, reminding us of His faithfulness.

verse: Deuteronomy 31:6 - Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you; He will never leave you nor forsake you.
excerpt: God’s enduring presence gives us strength and courage in every situation.

verse: Psalm 34:8 - Taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the one who takes refuge in Him.
excerpt: When we seek refuge in God, we experience His goodness and are truly blessed.

verse: 1 John 4:18 - There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, because fear has to do with punishment. The one who fears is not made perfect in love.
excerpt: God's perfect love eliminates fear, offering us peace and security.

verse: Isaiah 43:2 - When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.
excerpt: God promises His presence in all circumstances, protecting us from overwhelming trials.

verse: Psalm 139:14 - I praise You because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; Your works are wonderful, I know that full well.
excerpt: We are intricately created by God, and our existence reflects His wonderful works.

verse: 2 Timothy 4:7 - I have fought the good fight, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith.
excerpt: At the end of life's journey, the reward comes to those who remain faithful to God.

verse: Romans 5:3-4 - Not only so, but we also glory in our sufferings, because we know that suffering produces perseverance; perseverance, character; and character, hope.
excerpt: Trials build perseverance, which in turn produces strong character and hope in God.

verse: Matthew 22:37-39 - Jesus replied: 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second is like it: Love your neighbor as yourself.'
excerpt: The core of our faith is to love God fully and to love others as we love ourselves.

verse: James 1:5 - If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you.
excerpt: God generously grants wisdom to those who ask for it.

verse: 1 Thessalonians 5:16-18 - Rejoice always, pray continually, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
excerpt: We are called to live a life of continuous joy, prayer, and gratitude.

verse: Hebrews 4:12 - For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.
excerpt: God’s word is powerful, penetrating the deepest parts of our hearts and minds.

verse: Isaiah 55:8-9 - 'For My thoughts are not your thoughts, neither are your ways My ways,' declares the Lord. 'As the heavens are higher than the earth, so are My ways higher than your ways and My thoughts than your thoughts.'
excerpt: God’s ways and thoughts are beyond our understanding, higher than our own.

verse: John 10:10 - The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
excerpt: Jesus offers abundant life, far greater than what the world or the enemy can give.

verse: Proverbs 16:9 - In their hearts humans plan their course, but the Lord establishes their steps.
excerpt: We may make plans, but it is God who ultimately guides our path.

verse: Galatians 2:20 - I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives in me. The life I now live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.
excerpt: As believers, we are united with Christ, living by faith in His power and love.

verse: Isaiah 1:18 - 'Come now, let us settle the matter,' says the Lord. 'Though your sins are like scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they are red as crimson, they shall be like wool.'
excerpt: God offers complete forgiveness, transforming our sins into purity through His grace.

verse: Micah 6:8 - He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
excerpt: God calls us to live lives of justice, mercy, and humility before Him.

verse: Psalm 46:10 - He says, 'Be still, and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.'
excerpt: In the midst of chaos, we are invited to be still and recognize God's sovereignty.

verse: John 15:5 - I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in Me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from Me you can do nothing.
excerpt: Remaining connected to Jesus is essential for a fruitful and purposeful life.

verse: Jeremiah 33:3 - Call to Me and I will answer you and tell you great and unsearchable things you do not know.
excerpt: God promises to reveal profound truths to those who seek Him in prayer.

verse: Zephaniah 3:17 - The Lord your God is with you, the Mighty Warrior who saves. He will take great delight in you; in His love He will no longer rebuke you, but will rejoice over you with singing.
excerpt: God is a mighty warrior who delights in us, rejoicing over us with love.

verse: Romans 15:13 - May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in Him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
excerpt: God fills us with joy and peace when we trust in Him, allowing hope to overflow through the Holy Spirit.

verse: Isaiah 30:21 - Whether you turn to the right or to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, 'This is the way; walk in it.'
excerpt: God provides guidance at every crossroad, directing us on the right path.

verse: 2 Corinthians 4:16-18 - Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day. For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory that far outweighs them all. So we fix our eyes not on what is seen, but on what is unseen, since what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.
excerpt: Our present troubles are temporary, but they lead to an eternal reward that far outweighs the challenges.

verse: 1 Peter 2:9 - But you are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God’s special possession, that you may declare the praises of Him who called you out of darkness into His wonderful light.
excerpt: As God’s chosen people, we are called to proclaim His praises and reflect His light.

verse: Psalm 119:11 - I have hidden Your word in my heart that I might not sin against You.
excerpt: By treasuring God’s word in our hearts, we guard ourselves from sin.

verse: Proverbs 3:7-8 - Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear the Lord and shun evil. This will bring health to your body and nourishment to your bones.
excerpt: Revering God and avoiding evil brings both spiritual and physical well-being.

verse: 1 John 3:1 - See what great love the Father has lavished on us, that we should be called children of God! And that is what we are! The reason the world does not know us is that it did not know Him.
excerpt: God’s love is so great that He has called us His children, though the world may not understand.

verse: Psalm 119:9 - How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to Your word.
excerpt: Purity is maintained by living according to God’s word and principles.

verse: Isaiah 61:1 - The Spirit of the Sovereign Lord is on Me, because the Lord has anointed Me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent Me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim freedom for the captives and release from darkness for the prisoners.
excerpt: God’s anointing empowers us to bring healing, freedom, and hope to the world.

verse: Colossians 1:16 - For in Him all things were created: things in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or powers or rulers or authorities; all things have been created through Him and for Him.
excerpt: Everything in the universe was created through and for Christ, highlighting His supreme authority.

verse: Psalm 63:1 - You, God, are my God, earnestly I seek You; I thirst for You, my whole being longs for You, in a dry and parched land where there is no water.
excerpt: In times of spiritual dryness, our soul longs for God’s refreshing presence.

verse: Luke 6:38 - Give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together and running over, will be poured into your lap. For with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.
excerpt: Generosity is rewarded by God, who blesses us abundantly in return.

verse: Philippians 1:6 - Being confident of this, that He who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus.
excerpt: God, who initiated a good work in us, is faithful to bring it to completion.

verse: Ezekiel 36:26 - I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh.
excerpt: God promises to transform us, giving us a new heart that is sensitive to His Spirit.

verse: Matthew 28:19-20 - Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.
excerpt: Jesus commissions us to share the gospel, with the promise of His constant presence.

verse: Acts 4:12 - Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved.
excerpt: Salvation comes only through Jesus Christ; He is the one way to eternal life.

verse: Jeremiah 17:7-8 - But blessed is the one who trusts in the Lord, whose confidence is in Him. They will be like a tree planted by the water that sends out its roots by the stream. It does not fear when heat comes; its leaves are always green. It has no worries in a year of drought and never fails to bear fruit.
excerpt: Those who trust in God are deeply rooted, enduring difficulties and continuing to bear fruit.

verse: Romans 10:9 - If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead, you will be saved.
excerpt: Salvation comes through confessing Jesus as Lord and believing in His resurrection.

verse: Psalm 19:14 - May these words of my mouth and this meditation of my heart be pleasing in Your sight, Lord, my Rock and my Redeemer.
excerpt: Our thoughts and words should always be pleasing to God, our Redeemer.

verse: Hebrews 13:8 - Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
excerpt: Christ’s nature and promises remain unchanging throughout time.

verse: Proverbs 4:23 - Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.
excerpt: Our hearts are the wellspring of life, so we must protect and nurture them.

verse: 1 Corinthians 15:58 - Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.
excerpt: Our work for God is never wasted, so we must remain steadfast.

verse: Psalm 91:4 - He will cover you with His feathers, and under His wings you will find refuge; His faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.
excerpt: God offers protection and refuge under His wings of faithfulness.

verse: Luke 12:32 - Do not be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.
excerpt: God has graciously given His kingdom to His children, offering us eternal security.

verse: Romans 6:23 - For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
excerpt: Though sin leads to death, God offers eternal life through Jesus Christ.

verse: 1 John 5:14 - This is the confidence we have in approaching God: that if we ask anything according to His will, He hears us.
excerpt: When we pray in line with God’s will, we can be confident that He hears us.

verse: Psalm 37:5 - Commit your way to the Lord; trust in Him and He will do this.
excerpt: When we commit our lives to God and trust Him, He faithfully guides us.

verse: Philippians 4:19 - And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of His glory in Christ Jesus.
excerpt: God is able to supply all of our needs through His abundant grace in Christ.

verse: Matthew 5:9 - Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God.
excerpt: Those who promote peace are recognized as true children of God.

verse: Isaiah 53:5 - But He was pierced for our transgressions, He was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought us peace was on Him, and by His wounds we are healed.
excerpt: Christ’s suffering brings us peace and healing from the consequences of sin.

verse: Colossians 3:12 - Therefore, as God’s chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience.
excerpt: As God’s chosen people, we are called to reflect His character in our relationships.

verse: Psalm 32:8 - I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will counsel you with My loving eye on you.
excerpt: God promises to guide and teach us with His loving wisdom.

verse: Galatians 5:22-23 - But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control. Against such things there is no law.
excerpt: The Holy Spirit produces godly qualities within us, like love, joy, and self-control.

verse: Matthew 6:34 - Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
excerpt: Jesus teaches us to live in the present, trusting God for tomorrow.

verse: John 14:6 - Jesus answered, 'I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through Me.'
excerpt: Jesus is the only way to God the Father and eternal life.

verse: Jeremiah 32:27 - I am the Lord, the God of all mankind. Is anything too hard for Me?
excerpt: Nothing is impossible for God, who rules over all creation.

verse: 1 Corinthians 2:9 - However, as it is written: 'What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, and what no human mind has conceived'—the things God has prepared for those who love Him.
excerpt: God has prepared unimaginable blessings for those who love Him.

verse: Isaiah 55:6 - Seek the Lord while He may be found; call on Him while He is near.
excerpt: We are urged to seek God and call upon Him while He is near.

verse: Luke 1:37 - For no word from God will ever fail.
excerpt: God’s word is unfailing and His promises always come to pass.

verse: Romans 12:21 - Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
excerpt: As believers, we are called to conquer evil by doing good.

verse: Psalm 55:16 - As for me, I call to God, and the Lord saves me.
excerpt: When we call upon God, He hears and saves us from our troubles.

verse: James 4:7 - Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
excerpt: By submitting to God and resisting temptation, we can overcome the devil.

verse: Matthew 19:26 - Jesus looked at them and said, 'With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.'
excerpt: God is able to accomplish what seems impossible to humans.

verse: Proverbs 31:30 - Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised.
excerpt: True value is found in a woman’s reverence for God, rather than in external appearances.

verse: Psalm 34:19 - The righteous person may have many troubles, but the Lord delivers him from them all.
excerpt: Though the righteous may face many trials, God promises deliverance from them.

verse: 1 Peter 5:10 - And the God of all grace, who called you to His eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered a little while, will Himself restore you and make you strong, firm and steadfast.
excerpt: After enduring suffering, God Himself will restore and strengthen us.

verse: Isaiah 40:8 - The grass withers and the flowers fall, but the word of our God endures forever.
excerpt: God’s word is eternal, standing firm even when all else fades away.

verse: Psalm 31:24 - Be strong and take heart, all you who hope in the Lord.
excerpt: Those who hope in the Lord are called to be strong and courageous.

verse: Revelation 21:4 - 'He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death' or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away.
excerpt: In the new heaven and earth, God will eliminate all pain, suffering, and death.

verse: Ecclesiastes 3:1 - There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under the heavens.
excerpt: God has ordained a proper time and season for every aspect of life.

verse: James 1:17 - Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.
excerpt: God is the source of every good gift, and His character remains constant.

verse: Matthew 18:20 - For where two or three gather in My name, there am I with them.
excerpt: Jesus promises His presence whenever believers gather in His name.

verse: Psalm 27:14 - Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.
excerpt: We are encouraged to patiently wait on God, finding strength in Him.

verse: John 3:17 - For God did not send His Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through Him.
excerpt: Jesus came not to condemn, but to offer salvation to the world.

verse: 1 Chronicles 16:11 - Look to the Lord and His strength; seek His face always.
excerpt: We are called to continually seek God and rely on His strength.

verse: Philippians 2:3 - Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.
excerpt: As believers, we are called to act in humility, placing others above ourselves.

verse: 2 Timothy 3:16-17 - All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness, so that the servant of God may be thoroughly equipped for every good work.
excerpt: The Bible, inspired by God, equips us for every aspect of life and service.

verse: Proverbs 3:3 - Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.
excerpt: We are to live lives marked by love and faithfulness, keeping them close to our hearts.

verse: Matthew 11:30 - For My yoke is easy and My burden is light.
excerpt: Jesus invites us to take on His light burden, promising rest for our souls.

verse: Isaiah 12:2 - Surely God is my salvation; I will trust and not be afraid. The Lord, the Lord Himself, is my strength and my defense; He has become my salvation.
excerpt: God is both our strength and salvation, giving us reason to trust and not fear.
